question: What are my lease-end options?
answer: Your options are simple. You can: 1. Turn in your vehicle and purchase or lease a new Toyota.1 2. Purchase the vehicle you're currently driving. 3. Return your vehicle to a Toyota or Lexus dealership.* 1 _Options are available on approved credit through your dealer and Toyota Financial Services. Not all applicants will qualify. Additional options are available. See your dealer for details._ *_Your originating Dealer is required to process the vehicle return. Most Toyota and Lexus Dealers will process a return even if they did not originate the lease, but we recommend contacting them to confirm and schedule a turn-in appointment.​_ [Download Lease End Guide](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/content/dam/nextgen-shared/lease-end/TFS-lease-end-guide.pdf)

question: How do I prepare for Lease-End?
answer: Check out our [Lease-End Guide](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/content/dam/nextgen-shared/lease-end/TFS-lease-end-guide.pdf) that provides details on considering your options, timing for an inspection, excessive wear and use, and finalizing your decision.

question: What do I need to do to return my vehicle?
answer: Our [Lease-End Guide](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/content/dam/nextgen-shared/lease-end/TFS-lease-end-guide.pdf) provides an overview of the lease-end process, and checklists to help guide you through the before, during, and after your return. The vehicle must be returned to an authorized Toyota or Lexus Dealer. We recommend contacting your originating Dealer* to schedule your turn-in appointment. Your originating Dealer is required to process the vehicle return. If you return the vehicle to a third-party dealership, this is an unauthorized third-party vehicle return and you remain responsible for all obligations under the lease agreement until we receive the payoff funds and all required documentation, or the vehicle is delivered to a Toyota or Lexus Dealer. _*Most Toyota and Lexus Dealers will process a vehicle return even if they did not originate the lease, but we recommend contacting them to confirm and schedule a turn-in appointment._ [Download checklist](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/content/dam/nextgen-shared/lease-end/TFS-lease-end-guide.pdf)

question: Where do I turn in my leased vehicle?
answer: The vehicle must be returned to an authorized Toyota or Lexus Dealer.* If you've moved since you began your lease, use our easy dealer locator to find a participating dealer near you. We recommend contacting the dealer to schedule your lease turn-in appointment approximately 30 days prior to your lease maturity date. *_Your originating Dealer is required to process the vehicle return. Most Toyota and Lexus Dealers, while not required, will process a return, even if they did not originate the lease, but we recommend contacting them to confirm and schedule a turn-in appointment.​_

question: Who is my originating dealer?
answer: Your originating dealer is the dealer where you began your lease. This dealer can help you choose your next Toyota and turn in your current leased vehicle.

question: What if I turn in my vehicle early?
answer: You may return your vehicle prior to your lease maturity date; however, early termination fees may apply. For more info about turning in your lease early, refer to your lease agreement, or contact TFS at **1-800-286-0652**. You may also reach out to your dealer to get answers to any questions you have about your options.

question: Can I return my leased vehicle to any dealer?
answer: The vehicle must be returned to an authorized Toyota or Lexus Dealer. We recommend contacting your originating Dealer* to schedule your turn-in appointment. Your originating Dealer is required to process the vehicle return. If you return the vehicle to a third-party dealership, this is an unauthorized third-party vehicle return and you remain responsible for all obligations under the lease agreement until we receive the payoff funds and all required documentation, or the vehicle is delivered to a Toyota or Lexus Dealer. _*Most Toyota and Lexus Dealers will process a vehicle return even if they did not originate the lease, but we recommend contacting them to confirm and schedule a turn-in appointment._

question: Should I schedule an appointment to return my vehicle to my Toyota dealer?
answer: Yes, just give your dealer a call 30 days prior to your lease maturity date to schedule your lease turn-in appointment.

question: What should I bring to my turn-in appointment?
answer: Bring your clean, leased vehicle along with: * Your TFS [Odometer Disclosure Statement](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/content/dam/nextgen-shared/lease-end/TF_odometer_statement_6197.pdf) * Tool kit and spare tire, if applicable * All sets of keys (masters/remotes/valet), if applicable * Owner's Manuals * Any original equipment on your vehicle at lease inception (radio, headrests, 3rd row seat, tonneau/cargo cover, etc.) As a heads up, if you don't return the original equipment or keys at the end of your lease, you may receive additional charges based on the terms of your lease agreement.

question: Should I notify Toyota Financial Services after I have returned my leased vehicle?
answer: Yes, to minimize any potential delays processing your lease return, you can notify us of your return by logging on to Toyotafinancial.com or your Toyota Financial Services App and follow the Lease End return prompts. You can also notify us by telephone at (800) 874-8822 using our automated system or speaking with a live agent. [Log in to my account](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/dss/login?deeplink=return_vehicle)

question: What happens after I return my vehicle?
answer: At the Dealership * Confirm the Dealership will accept the return. Only your originating Dealer is required to accept your lease return. To minimize any potential delays processing your lease return, you can notify us of your return by logging onto Toyotafinancial.com or your Toyota Financial Services App and follow the Lease End return prompts. You can also notify us by telephone at (800) 874-8822 using our automated system or speaking with a live agent. * The dealership will complete a final inspection at your return appointment, and ask you to sign the [Odometer Disclsoure Statement](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/content/dam/nextgen-shared/lease-end/TF_odometer_statement_6197.pdf), and provide you with a copy of it for your records. Capture the name of dealer associate that helped with the return. After Return * TFS will send you a Lease-End invoice if you have any unpaid payments, late fees and miscellaneous charges. The invoice will also include Excessive Wear and Use charges, Excessive Mileage charges, and Disposition Fee if applicable. These items may be taxable. * If you had a security deposit, it will be returned to your home address via check. It will be used to first pay any Lease-End invoice charges, if applicable. * [Cancel any electronic payments](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/dss/login?deeplink=paymentspayments). [Log in to my account](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/dss/login?deeplink=return_vehicle)

question: How will TFS contact me before my lease ends?
answer: Leading up to lease-end, you'll receive various communications from TFS about your options and things you need to do. Be on the lookout for information from us through toyotafinancial.com, email and/or phone calls.

question: What is my lease maturity date?
answer: This is the date when your lease agreement ends and your vehicle should be returned to a Toyota dealer (unless you choose the option to purchase your leased vehicle).

question: What charges should I expect on my End of Term Invoice after I turn in my vehicle?
answer: Like you, we hope you have no charges2 on your lease-end, but it's possible these may be included, if applicable: 1. Excess wear and use 2. Excess mileage 3. Disposition fee 4. Any past due and unpaid monthly payments 5. Any other miscellaneous charges (e.g., unpaid late payment fees, taxes, tolls) 6. Any other charges due under the terms of your lease agreement if your lease was terminated early 2 _Charges may vary based on the terms of your lease agreement, whether any optional protection plans were purchased and such coverage applies._

question: Do I return my license plates when I turn in my vehicle?
answer: Great question - it varies by state. Please contact your Toyota dealer or the DMV if you have questions about how this applies to you.

question: Do I need to cancel any electronic payments at the end of my lease?
answer: Yes, and this is one people forget. If you've returned your vehicle, please remember to cancel any automated payments you may have set up through either toyotafinancial.com or your bank.

question: How do I purchase my current vehicle?
answer: First, great decision. Next, get a payoff quote by logging into your [TFS online account](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/dss/login?deeplink=purchase_vehicle) or contacting TFS at **1-800-286-0652**. If you need financing, you can head straight to your dealer for help.[](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/dss/login?deeplink=purchase_vehicle)

question: What’s the easiest way to get into a new Toyota?
answer: Just bring your vehicle back to your Toyota dealer at the end of your lease and they can help you with the rest.

question: What’s considered excessive wear and use?
answer: It probably seems obvious, but damage that is beyond normal wear and use is considered excessive If it helps to see some examples of what's considered excessive, check out our [Wear and Use Guidelines](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/content/dam/nextgen-shared/lease-end/Toyota_Lease-End_EWU.pdf). We also recommend reviewing your lease agreement as it includes additional excess wear and use information specific to your vehicle. Just a heads up, though, the examples provided may not include all instances of excessive damage that could subject you to additional charges based on the terms of your lease agreement.

question: Can I make repairs to my lease vehicle so I don’t incur wear and use charges?
answer: Of course. In fact, we encourage you to schedule a complimentary inspection3 and to review the [Wear and Use Guidelines](https://www.toyotafinancial.com/content/dam/nextgen-shared/lease-end/Toyota_Lease-End_EWU.pdf) to see whether your vehicle has wear and use that is considered excessive. If repair work is needed and you'd like to make repairs prior to turning in the vehicle, your local Toyota dealer is a great option to assist you. Be sure to keep all of your receipts for repairs made and review your insurance policy to see if any items may be covered. If your damages exceeding normal wear and use aren't repaired, it can result in charges at lease termination.4 All charges may be subject to sales tax. 3 _Available to Toyota Financial Services lease customers that do not reside in Alaska or Hawaii and whose leases did not originate in New Hampshire or Wisconsin._ 4 _If repairs are made to your vehicle, you or the dealer may request an inspection upon turn-in. Under certain circumstances, Toyota Financial Services does not charge its lease customers for excess wear and use damage. See your lease agreement for additional information._

question: What is a courtesy pre-inspection?
answer: A courtesy pre-inspection by your Toyota dealer assesses the condition of your vehicle and provides an estimate of wear and use charges that could be due at lease-end.3 3 _Courtesy pre-inspection available to lease customers who do not reside in Hawaii or whose leases did not originate in New Hampshire or Wisconsin._

question: How do I schedule a courtesy pre-inspection appointment?
answer: You can contact your originating dealer or any Toyota dealer to determine if they can conduct a courtesy pre-inspection and schedule an appointment.3 3 _Courtesy pre-inspection available to lease customers who do not reside in Hawaii or whose leases did not originate in New Hampshire or Wisconsin._

question: What do I need for my courtesy pre-inspection and lease return appointments?
answer: Bring the following to your courtesy pre-inspection and lease return appointments3: * Vehicle keys * Toolkit and spare tire * Owner's Manual * Original equipment 3 _Courtesy pre-inspection available to lease customers who do not reside in Hawaii or whose leases did not originate in New Hampshire or Wisconsin._

question: What should I do after my courtesy pre-inspection?
answer: After your courtesy pre-inspection, you can discuss the inspection report immediately with the dealer in person. You can also access the report via the Document Center on our mobile app or toyotafinancial.com. You can make repairs before turning in your vehicle-just be sure to keep receipts for your records

question: Where can I find my mileage allowance?
answer: The easiest way to find your mileage allowance is by looking at your lease agreement. If you can't find your lease agreement - no worries - your friends at your local dealer will be happy to help you find it.

question: What if I go over my mileage allowance?
answer: No problem, it happens. You just need to call your dealer and they can give you more info on any potential charges.

question: Can I get additional miles?
answer: We love the question and wish there was a way to purchase additional miles. Unfortunately, we're not currently offering that as an option.
